Author: SemicolonButterfly
Text: I’m also an alcoholic in recovery and I’ve noticed that sugar (at least the refined white sugar in candy/baked goods/etc.) has a noticeable adverse effect on my body and mind. I’m super tired the next day, my mood is less stable and more probe to depression, and those freakin sugar cravings go off the chart.   If I stay away from sugary foods for a week or so, the cravings are gone. My carb-desires are normal again, which is *such* a relief.   I’m still figuring out exactly what’s going to be healthy and sustainable for me. So far I’ve been cycling through sugar abstinence...moderation...whoops-iz-too-much every few months. But I definitely feel that realizing how sugar affects me has been a positive thing overall.
